column1: # SDN Packet definition. From PLC to FC
# Any line starting with a # will be ignored

column5: if ACDC the range is same as the DC one. 0 to 150 V in L range or 0 to 300 V in H range
How long before tripping (maybe fixed). 0 to 10 s
Not sure if Japaneses use the AC or ACDC mode. 0 to 215 V in L range or 0 to 430 V in H range
Sets the time that must elapse after the internal semiconductor protection is activated before an alarm is generated (maybe fixed). 1 to 3 s

SM - Segregation Channel - Detect when the alarm rises and send the correct command to FC to try to synchronize it. 16#CC=Release control 16#BB=Take control
This could be fixed to one or the other range and not configurable at run time. 0=L(150) 1=H(300)

column6: off: switch to CC mode (maybe no need to be configurable and fix to trip). 0=OFF 1=ON

column5: Enables or disables the limit on the current setting. 0=OFF 1=ON
Set whether to limit the voltage setting so that it does not exceed the OVP setting or become lower than the UVP setting.. 0=OFF 1=ON
